info.desc: Mark up text the user should input into a computer program.

page.title: User Input
page.p: Use the input element to mark up text that is input b the user. This may be text entered into a command-line environment or into a text field in a graphical application.

item.p: The style attribute takes a space-separated list of style hints. Processing tools should adjust their behavior according to those style hints they understand.
The input element, together with the output element, may be used to mark up the contents of a screen element, allowing processing tools to treat them differently.
The input element can link to other pages or documents. See for more information.
The input element can have attributes from external namespaces. See for more information on external-namespace attributes on inline elements.

section.title: Processing Expectations
section.p: User input should be displayed in a fixed-width or wide font. Fixed-width fonts tend to have more distinction between visually similar characters. Display tools may use a background color or border to make the beginning and end of the intut clear.

section.title: Comparison to DocBook
section.p: The input element is similar to the userinput element in DocBook.
